message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.GR, cs.AI. 

This paper deals with the problem of video harmonization, which involves improving the realism of composite results in videos. This is a problem that falls under computer vision, specifically in the area of image and video processing. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). 

The paper also uses adversarial networks and convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to achieve its results, which are techniques commonly used in machine learning. This suggests that the paper could also belong to the sub-categories of cs.MM (Multimedia) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

Additionally, the paper proposes a method for building a synthetic dataset to support supervised training of the proposed adversarial network. This involves generating synthetic foreground masks and optical flows, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.GR (Graphics). 

Finally, the paper's use of temporal consistency in video harmonization suggests that it could also belong to the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), which deals with the development of algorithms and systems that exhibit intelligent behavior.
